intro: Micromeria bahamensis, commonly known as the Bahamian micromeria, is a small shrub native to the Bahamas. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and has small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in late spring. Its leaves are narrow and have a distinctive, slightly fuzzy texture. Micromeria bahamensis is adapted to sandy soils and is often found in dune environments.
